page.title: 14ASTLEY BRIDGE FARM (3)
page.content: At Astley Bridge Farm the wheat and barley is sown in the Autumn.It is harvested in August using the combine harvester.At the front of the combine there is a large revolving wheel and a cutting blade which cuts the corn and gathers it into the machine.The ears of the corn is separated from the stalks. The straw comes out of the back of the combine.It is baled later,loaded onto a trailer and stored in the barn.This straw is worth about 100 pounds a ton. It can be used as winter feed for the cattle.Some of the wheat and barley they grow is sent to the mills to be ground into flour.Rape is a recent crop that has been grown.It is used to help make margarine and cooking oil.
